alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Humboldt; Pocahontas; Sac; Winnebago (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 15 at 3:28PM CDT until March 17 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Rain Changing to Snow and Blowing Snow Thursday into Thursday night... .A winter storm will track through the region on Thursday with travel impacts likely over portions of northwest and north central Iowa. Rain will change to snow Thursday morning as a cold front moves through Iowa. The front will also bring strong northwest winds. Blowing snow will lead to significantly reduced visibilities from northwest Iowa into portions of north central Iowa and may approach blizzard conditions. While much of the snow will end Thursday evening, the wind will remain strong and gusty from the northwest through Friday with blowing snow remaining a concern for travelers. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THURSDAY TO 7 AM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...parts of northwest and north central Iowa. * WHEN...From 11 AM Thursday to 7 AM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while driving. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 511 app, www.511ia.org, or dial 511.
